document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Scopocira Simon, 1900 (Araneae: Salticidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Simon

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Scopocira tenella
Simon, 1900
: 386
(Female holotype from Rio Salobro (near Ilhéus?), Bahia, Brazil , deposited in MNHN , examined);
Galiano, 1963
: 440
, pl. XXXVI, figs 10‒11 ; World Spider Catalog, 2014 .

Scopocira pikelinae
Galiano, 1958
: 21
, figs 1 A‒I (Male holotype from Bahia, Brazil ,
10 .VIII. 1953
, Duret, deposited in MACN 4955 , examined). Synonymized by
Galiano, 1963
: 440
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 192. Record map for
S. fuscimana
and S. tenella .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Males of
S. tenella
are similar to those of both
S. kunai
and
S. cyrili
by the developed dorsal portion of the embolus, but can easily be recognized by the acute ITA, dorsally projected (Fig. 182 ; absent in the other two species). Females have more squared spermathecae (Fig. 185 ).

Description. Male ( MPEG 20820 ).
Total length: 2.99 . Carapace orange, 1.52 long, 0.99 wide, 0.67 high (Fig. 180 ). Ocular quadrangle 0.96 long. Anterior eye row 0.99 wide and posterior 0.91 wide. Palp yellow (Figs 181‒182 ); tegulum with thumb-like projection on distal, retrolateral portion; RvTA projected retrolaterally; ITA acute and dorsally projected; embolus tip broad, with an acute, sickle-like paraembolic projection, and large DEA with denticles along its border. Legs 1423 , I orange, II‒IV yellow. Length of femur: I 1.33 , II 0.89 , III 0.87 , IV 1.15 ; patella + tibia: I 1.75 , II 1.04 , III 0.97 , IV 1.27 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 1.27 , II 0.92 , III 1.03 , IV 1.36 . Spination on ventral tibia I: 2 - 2 - 2 - 2 . Abdomen cream-colored, with sparse scales and brown areas dorsally (Fig. 180 ); ventrally cream-colored.

Female ( MPEG 20835 ).
Total length: 3.83 . Carapace orange, 1.62 long, 1.07 wide, 0.65 high (Fig 183 ). Ocular quadrangle 0.89 long. Anterior eye row 1.07 wide and posterior 0.96 wide. Legs 4132 , light yellow. Length of femur: I 1.13 , II 0.86 , III 0.84 , IV 1.14 ; patella + tibia: I 1.45 , II 1.03 , III 0.99 , IV 1.35 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 1.10 , II 0.91 , III 1.02 , IV 1.08 . Spination as in male. Abdomen as in male. Epigyne as in Figs 184‒185 .
